definition: to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: In US, our students don't take a standardized test as the Chinese students.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，我們的學生不像中國學生那樣要參加統考。

sentences.english: After my state exam, I had to decide on a profession within the law.
sentences.chinese: 國家統考過後，我必須要在法律界確定職業。

sentences.english: The national tests were educationally unsound.
sentences.chinese: 從教育角度看，全國統考是不合理的。

sentences.english: Lucky for me I did well in the finals despite not doing a day of study.
sentences.chinese: 所幸即使沒再學一天功課，統考的成績也不差。

sentences.english: The school teachers and students from the burden of examination and the entrance examination pressure.
sentences.chinese: 而學校裏師生的負擔來自統考以及升學考試的壓力。

sentences.english: About Teaching Excellence Award, awards are decided generally by unified test which includes main courses of Literature and Math, but no subsidiary courses.
sentences.chinese: 關於傑出教師獎，目前都是基於統考成績評定獎項。
